perturbation.original_text: 1.31 "SLA" means the Service Level Agreement attached hereto in Appendix 6.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.31 "SLA" means a general understanding of service expectations.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the definition of 'SLA' from a specific document (Appendix 6) to a vague 'general understanding,' the contract now lacks a concrete mechanism for service level enforcement. Sections referencing the SLA will be ambiguous.

perturbation.original_text:
16.1 ELEPHANT TALK shall order and purchase SIM cards.

16.2 In principle the *** will be of *** will remain the property of T-Mobile at all times.

16.3 T-Mobile shall retain at all times full ownership of its intellectual property rights vested in the software (including T-Moible's and its supplier related software and codes, but excluding typical ELEPHANT TALK's and/or other party's content) contained in the T-Mobile IMSI's.     16.4  Parties agree that they will re-discuss the provisioning of a ***, the implementation and associated costs of the *** shall be considered part of the Agreement and therefore shall not result in additional costs for ELEPHANT TALK provided that no *** are involved. ELEPHANT TALK shall retain at all times full ownership of its intellectual property rights vested in the software contained in the *** .
perturbation.changed_text:
16.1 ELEPHANT TALK shall order SIM cards.

16.2 Ownership of SIM cards will be determined on a case-by-case basis.

16.3 The parties will negotiate intellectual property rights related to the SIM cards in good faith.     16.4  Parties may discuss the provisioning of additional services related to SIM cards. Costs will be determined separately.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly defines ownership and IP rights related to SIM cards. The revised text introduces ambiguity about ownership and IP rights related to the SIM cards, and cost. This directly contradicts the previous firm statements and create internal uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text:
5.1 A trial period, covering the *** calendar months from Commercial Launch Date shall apply for ELEPHANT TALK in order to gain experiences and knowledge for ELEPHANT TALK on forecasting and call behavior of its ELEPHANT TALK Customers. ***.

5.2 ELEPHANT TALK shall provide Quarterly forecasts in writing expressed in volume for the use of the Hosting Services. Details as Parties have agreed upon regarding the forecasts are stipulated in Appendix 4.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1 A trial period may apply for ELEPHANT TALK to gain experience on forecasting. 

5.2 ELEPHANT TALK should provide forecasts as practical.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the mandatory 'shall provide Quarterly forecasts' to an optional 'should provide forecasts as practical' removes a defined timeline for forecasting. It creates a contradiction because the original text implies regular forecasts, while the modified text makes them discretionary.
